derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sin(e)we 'tendon', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zeen and German Sehne

entry.def: A sinew is a cord in your body that connects a muscle to a bone.

means.word_mean: 1. a cord or band of inelastic tissue connecting a muscle with its bony attachment
